hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The closest of people to me on the Day of Resurrection will be the one who most beneficially benefits others.'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Anas bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Islam is built on five: testimony that there is no god but Allah, and Muhammad is His Messenger, establishing prayer, paying zakat, fasting Ramadan, and Hajj to the House.'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him)
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The strength of a believer is good character and patience.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among you are those who have the best manners and character.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should speak good or remain silent.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of people are those that bring most benefit to the rest of mankind.'
The Messenger of Allah said, 'Faith increases with good manners and decreases with sins.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever tests Allah's patience, Allah will test him with patience.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most beloved deeds to Allah are those that are continuous, even if they are small.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A believer is not bitten from the same hole twice.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The key to Paradise is prayer.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best prayer is the prayer of David, and the best fasting is the fasting of David.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The closest a servant is to his Lord is when he is prostrating, so increase in supplication then.'
The Messenger (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Prayers are a light for the believer.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Perform prayer at its earliest time.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever prays the two cool prayers (Fajr and Asr) will enter Paradise.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The prayer is the pillar of religion.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of you are those who learn the Quran and teach it.'
The Messenger (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Pray as you have seen me praying.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The prayer is a means of expiation for sins.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Charity does not decrease wealth. No one forgives another except that Allah increases his honor.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Every act of kindness is charity.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Give charity without delay, for it stands in the way of calamity.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best charity is that which is given when one is rich.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Save yourself from hellfire even by giving half a date in charity.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best charity is that given in Ramadan.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Charity does not decrease wealth.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The charity given to a poor person is a charity, and if he accepts it, it is a good deed for the giver.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Every Muslim is a brother to every Muslim, and it is unlawful for a Muslim to forsake his brother.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best charity is that given when one is in good health, and wealthy.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Patience is at the first stroke of a calamity.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'No one is given a gift better and more comprehensive than patience.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The strong is not the one who overcomes the people by his strength, but the strong is the one who controls himself while in anger.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Patience is a light.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Verily, with hardship comes ease.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Patience is a virtue and a sign of faith.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who is patient and forgiving, Allah will reward him.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Patience and prayer are the best remedies for the believer.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The one who bears patiently whatever afflicts him will have his patience rewarded.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Patience is light, and Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who does not thank people does not thank Allah.'

The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Look at those below you (less fortunate) and do not look at those above you, for this is more suitable to prevent you from neglecting Allah's blessings.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever is not grateful for small favors, he will not be grateful for large ones.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who is not grateful for the favors of Allah is not grateful to Allah.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of people are those most beneficial to others.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Eat and drink, be grateful, and increase in charity.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most beloved of deeds to Allah is gratitude.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who is not grateful for Allah's favors is not grateful to Allah.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Thankfulness increases sustenance.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Thankfulness for Allah's blessings is a sign of His love.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah is kind and loves kindness. He grants for kindness what He does not grant for harshness.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah is pleased with kindness and kindnessing others.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Be kind to your children and be generous to your neighbors.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who is not merciful to people, Allah will not be merciful to him.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Kindness and mercy are the foundation of all good deeds.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'God is Merciful and loves mercy; He grants for mercy what He does not grant for harshness.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Show mercy to those on the earth, and the One above the heavens will show mercy to you.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of people are those with the most beneficial kindness.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The kindest of people towards the believers is the one who is most beneficial.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah is kind and loves kindness in all matters.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever fasts Ramadan out of faith and seeking reward, will have his past sins forgiven.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Fasting is a shield from the fire and from sins.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Fasting and the Quran will intercede for the servant on the Day of Resurrection.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The fast is a shield from the fire.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Fast in the month of Ramadan, and then there are six days of Shawwal, and it will be as if you fasted for a lifetime.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Fasting is half of patience.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Fasting is a shield from the Hellfire.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Fasting is a shield and protection for the believer.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Fasting and prayer are the two pillars of Islam.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Fasting is a shield from the fire and the sins.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever performs Hajj and does not commit sin or dispute unjustly, he will come out as free from sin as the day his mother bore him.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Perform Hajj and Umrah consecutively, for they remove poverty and sins as the bellows remove impurities from iron.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The reward for Hajj accepted by Allah is Paradise.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever performs Hajj properly, without committing any evil or wickedness, will return free from sins.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Hajj is the best deed.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever performs Hajj and does not commit any evil, his sins will be forgiven.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Hajj is the most virtuous of deeds.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Hajj and Umrah remove poverty and sins.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever performs Hajj for Allah's pleasure and does not commit sin, he will return free from sin.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of deeds is Hajj.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The honest merchant will be with the prophets, the truthful, and the martyrs.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Beware of dishonesty, for it leads to the Hellfire.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Truthfulness leads to righteousness, and righteousness leads to Paradise.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A truthful merchant will be with the prophets and the truthful.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most beloved of people to Allah is the one who is most beneficial.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Honesty leads to righteousness, and righteousness leads to Paradise.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of people are those who are most honest.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Honesty is a sign of faith, and lying is a sign of hypocrisy.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Truthfulness guides to righteousness.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Be honest, for honesty leads to righteousness.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever forgives and makes reconciliation, his reward is with Allah.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among people are those who forgive others.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'If anyone shows patience and forgives, that is among the great acts of courage.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'When a person forgives and makes reconciliation, Allah will elevate his status.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The one who forgives others is loved by Allah.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Forgiveness is the best act of charity.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah loves those who forgive.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever forgives and makes peace, his reward is with Allah.'
The Messenger of Allah (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among people are those who forgive easily.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Forgiveness is a sign of strength.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The pleasure of Allah lies in the pleasure of the parents, and the anger of Allah lies in the anger of the parents.'

A man asked the Prophet, 'O Messenger of Allah, who is the most deserving of my good companionship?' He said, 'Your mother.' The man asked, 'Then who?' He said, 'Your mother.' The man asked again, 'Then who?' He said, 'Your mother.' The man asked once more, 'Then who?' He said, 'Your father.'
A man asked the Prophet, 'O Messenger of Allah, what are the rights of parents over their children?' The Prophet said, 'They are your paradise or your hell.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A son’s good deeds are not accepted if he does not fulfill the rights of his parents.'
The Prophet said, 'Respect your parents and be good to them, for Paradise lies at their feet.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who does not show mercy to people, Allah will not show mercy to him.'
A man asked the Prophet about the best deeds. He replied, 'To be kind and dutiful to your mother.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Your mother, then your mother, then your mother, then your father.'
The Prophet said, 'Allah has cursed those women who imitate men and those men who imitate women.'
A man asked the Prophet, 'What is the best deed?' He said, 'To be good to your parents.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A child is a gift from Allah, and it is a duty to treat children kindly and with justice.'
The Prophet said, 'The best of you are those who are best to their children.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who does not show mercy to our little ones and respect to our elders is not one of us.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Children are a blessing and a trust from Allah.'
The Prophet said, 'Every child is born in a state of fitrah (natural disposition) and it is the parents who make him a Jew, Christian, or Magian.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A child's prayer is accepted if he prays with sincerity.'
The Prophet said, 'Treat your children kindly and teach them good manners.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) emphasized kindness to children and said, 'He who does not show mercy will not be shown mercy.'
The Prophet said, 'A child's happiness lies in being loved and well cared for.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A child who is loved and nurtured properly will be a source of pride in this world and the Hereafter.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Marriage is my Sunnah; whoever does not follow my Sunnah has nothing to do with me.'
The Prophet said, 'The best of you are those who are best to their wives.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Marry loving and fertile women, for I will boast of your great numbers before the other nations on the Day of Resurrection.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most perfect of believers in faith are those best in character, and the best of you are those who are best to their wives.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A woman is married for four reasons: her wealth, her lineage, her beauty, and her piety. Choose the pious, and you will be successful.'
The Prophet said, 'When a man marries, he has completed half of his faith; so let him fear Allah regarding the remaining half.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among you are those who are best to their wives.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A woman is married for four reasons: her wealth, her lineage, her beauty, and her piety. So, marry a pious woman.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Marry those who are loving and fertile, for I will boast of your great numbers before the other nations.'
The Prophet said, 'The best among you are those who are best to their wives.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who believes in Allah and the Last Day should honor his neighbor.'
The Prophet said, 'The neighbor of a Muslim should not harm him, nor should he oppress him.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him be good to his neighbor.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among people are those with the best manners and the most beneficial to their neighbors.'
The Prophet said, 'Your neighbor has rights over you, including not harming him and helping him in times of need.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who believes in Allah and the Last Day should honor his neighbor.'
The Prophet said, 'A Muslim is the one from whose tongue and hands other Muslims are safe.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who has a good neighbor has a good life.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best neighbor is the one who is most beneficial to his neighbor.'
The Prophet said, 'Help your neighbor whether he is an oppressor or he is oppressed.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A Muslim is the brother of another Muslim; he should not oppress him, nor should he abandon him.'
The Prophet said, 'The believers are like one body; if one part aches, the whole body suffers.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of people are those most beneficial to others.'
The Prophet said, 'Help your brother whether he is an oppressor or oppressed.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A believer to another believer is like a building, each part strengthening the other.'
The Prophet said, 'The strong believer is better and more beloved to Allah than the weak believer, but both are good.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among you are those who are best to their brothers.'

The Prophet said, 'Help your brother whether he is an oppressor or oppressed. If he is an oppressor, help him by preventing him from oppressing others; if he is oppressed, help him by supporting him.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A believer is a mirror to his brother.'
The Prophet said, 'The best of people are those with the best character and manners towards their brothers.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Modesty is part of faith.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Every religion has its high moral; the high moral of Islam is modesty.'
The Prophet said, 'Modesty and faith are inseparable; if one is taken away, the other is also gone.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Modesty does not bring anything except goodness.'
The Prophet said, 'Modesty is a branch of faith.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who is modest, Allah will enrich him.'
The Prophet said, 'Modesty and faith are two companions; if one is taken away, the other is also gone.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) emphasized, 'Modesty is among the good manners.'
The Prophet said, 'Modesty does not prevent anything but enhances good.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Modesty and faith go hand in hand; when one of them is lost, the other is lost too.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah is more pleased with the repentance of His servant than a person who finds his lost camel in the desert.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Every son of Adam sins, and the best of sinners are those who repent.'
The Prophet said, 'Repent to Allah, for I repent a hundred times a day.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever repents before sunrise from his sins is like one who has no sins.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah forgives all sins of those who turn to Him in repentance.'
The Prophet said, 'The best of those who seek forgiveness are those who sincerely repent.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Turn to Allah in repentance, for He loves those who repent.'
The Prophet said, 'Seek Allah’s forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The door of repentance is open until the sun rises from the west.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah is merciful and loves mercy.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Show mercy to others, and Allah will have mercy upon you.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah’s mercy encompasses everything; therefore, show mercy to those on the earth.'
The Prophet said, 'Allah’s mercy is greater than any anger.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah is more merciful to His servants than a mother is to her child.'
The Prophet said, 'Be merciful to those on the earth, and the One above the heavens will have mercy upon you.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah’s mercy surpasses His wrath.'
The Prophet said, 'Allah’s mercy is near to those who do good.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah’s mercy is more extensive than His punishment.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Show mercy and forgive, for Allah will forgive you.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Humility is a sign of faith.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who humbles himself for the sake of Allah, Allah will raise him in status.'
The Prophet said, 'The most beloved of people to Allah is the one who is most beneficial and humble.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Humility does not diminish your honor but increases your dignity.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah is with those who are humble.'
The Prophet said, 'Humility is a part of faith and a sign of sincerity.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The one who humbles himself for Allah’s sake, Allah will elevate him.'
The Prophet said, 'Humility is the way to Paradise.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The humble are exalted in the sight of Allah.'
The Prophet said, 'Humility is a characteristic of the righteous.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Beware of envy, for it consumes good deeds as fire consumes wood.'
The Prophet said, 'Do not envy one another, nor compete with one another, but be servants of Allah as brothers.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Envy destroys good deeds like fire destroys wood.'
The Prophet warned against envy and said, 'It consumes faith and good deeds.'

The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Envy is forbidden except in two cases: a person whom Allah has given wealth and he spends it righteously, and a person whom Allah has given wisdom and he acts upon it and teaches it.'
The Prophet said, 'Do not envy each other, but seek Allah’s favor and blessings.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Envy consumes good deeds as fire consumes wood or grass.'
The Prophet warned, 'Beware of envy, for it destroys faith.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Envy is a trait of the hypocrites; avoid it.'
The Prophet said, 'Envy destroys good deeds as fire destroys wood.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah commands justice and the doing of good, and giving to relatives; and forbids immorality, and bad conduct, and oppression.'

The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The just will be seated upon pulpits of light near Allah: those who are just in their rulings and in their dealings with their families and those who are under their authority.'

The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Help your brother, whether he is the oppressor or the oppressed.' A man asked, 'O Messenger of Allah, I help him if he is oppressed, but how do I help him if he is an oppressor?' The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'By preventing him from oppressing others.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Seeking knowledge is an obligation upon every Muslim.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of people are those that bring most benefit to mankind; the best of such benefits is knowledge.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever follows a path in pursuit of knowledge, Allah will make easy for him a path to Paradise.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Dua is the essence of worship.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Your Lord is pleased with a servant who raises his hands in supplication.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Invoke Allah and be confident that He will answer you.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among you are those who learn the Quran and teach it.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Recite the Quran, for it will come on the Day of Resurrection as an intercessor for its companions.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of you are those who learn the Quran and teach it.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever revives my Sunnah has loved me, and whoever loves me will be with me in Paradise.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'My community will never agree upon misguidance.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Part of the excellence of a person's Islam is leaving what does not concern him.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Hellfire has been prepared for the disbelievers and sinners.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The fire of Hell is surrounded by desires and passions.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The least punished among the people of Hellfire will have two slippers of fire and his brain will boil.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Paradise is surrounded by hardships, and Hellfire is surrounded by desires.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among you are those who are best to their families and I am the best to my family.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever enters Paradise will be pleased and will never be miserable.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Backbiting is worse than adultery.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Do you know what backbiting is?' They said, 'Allah and His Messenger know best.' He said, 'It is to mention your brother in a way he dislikes.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Avoid backbiting, for it is the most disgusting speech.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The liar will not enter Paradise.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A truthful and trustworthy merchant will be with the prophets, the truthful, and the martyrs.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever deliberately tells lies to deceive people will be recorded as a liar in the sight of Allah.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Trustworthiness will be the first attribute to be taken away from this world, and the last will be honesty in speech.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Every one of you is a shepherd, and every one of you is responsible for his flock.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The trustworthiness of the believer is in his honesty and integrity.'

The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of people are those that bring most benefit to mankind, and the most beloved of deeds to Allah is to make a Muslim happy, or to remove his hardship, or to pay off his debt, or to feed his hunger.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Trade is only permissible if it is free from deception and fraud.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The truthful merchant will be with the prophets, the truthful, and the martyrs.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best income is by honest trade.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A truthful merchant will be resurrected with the prophets, the truthful, and the martyrs.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best income is the honest trade.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Wealth is a blessing, but its excessive accumulation leads to destruction.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of people are those with beneficial wealth.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Wealth does not diminish by charity.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The love of wealth is the root of all evil.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Poverty is my pride.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Poverty is a shield from evil.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Poverty is my pride and honor.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Poverty leads to disbelief.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Poverty is a shield from evil.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Beware of oppression, for oppression will be darkness on the Day of Resurrection.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most oppressive of people are those who oppress others unjustly.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Oppression will be darkness on the Day of Resurrection.'

The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Help your brother whether he is an oppressor or oppressed.' A man asked, 'O Messenger of Allah, how do I help him if he is an oppressor?' He replied, 'By preventing him from oppressing others.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among you are those with the best manners.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most beloved of people to Allah is the one who has the best manners.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most perfect of believers in faith are those with the best manners.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'I have been sent to perfect good manners.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among you are those who have the best manners.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most beloved of people to Allah is the one who benefits people the most.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Sincerity is a part of faith.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Sincerity is a cause of Allah's love.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Sincerity leads to righteousness.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Sincerity is a secret that Allah keeps with whom He wills.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Sincerity is to be truthful in speech and action.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Sincerity will be the first to be cut off from my nation.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Sincerity and truthfulness lead to Paradise.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Every innovation (bid'ah) is misguidance, and every misguidance is in the Fire.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever introduces into this matter of ours (Islam) that which is not part of it will have it rejected.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Beware of newly invented matters, for every innovation is misguidance.'

hadiths.by: Narrated by Ali ibn Abi Talib
hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The worst of affairs are the newly invented matters.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most evil of affairs are the innovations.'
The angels do not enter a house in which there is a dog or a picture.
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The angels do not enter a house where there is a dog or a picture.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The angels do not enter a house in which there is a dog or a picture.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The angels do not enter a house with a dog or an image.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The angels do not enter a house where there is a dog or an image.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Jinn are of three types: one that flies in the air, one that resembles dogs and wolves, and one that whispers into the hearts of men.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Jinn are of three types: those that fly in the air, those that resemble dogs and wolves, and those that whisper into the hearts of men.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Jinn are of three types: one that flies in the air, one that resembles dogs and wolves, and one that whispers into the hearts of men.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The jinn are of three types: ones that fly in the air, ones that resemble dogs and wolves, and ones that whisper into the hearts of men.'

The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The Hour will come when knowledge will be taken away, earthquakes will increase, and time will pass quickly.'

hadiths.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among you are those who have the best health and the best wealth.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Cleanliness is half of faith.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Cleanliness is part of faith.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah is pure and loves purity.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Cleanliness is part of faith.'

Hadith on Generosity.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of people are those that bring most benefit to others.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best charity is that which is given when one is healthy and greedy for wealth.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Every day, two angels descend and one of them prays: O Allah, give to the spender in Your way; and the other says: O Allah, destroy the spender.'

Hadith on Bribery.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah has cursed the one who bribes and the one who accepts a bribe.'

Hadith on Bribery.by: Narrated by Abd Allah ibn Mas'ud
Hadith on Bribery.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A person who takes a bribe is like a person who eats illegal flesh.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) cursed the one who gives and the one who takes bribes.

Hadith on Gossip.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Gossiping destroys good deeds just as vinegar destroys honey.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A Muslim is the one from whose tongue and hands other Muslims are safe.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Do you know what backbiting is?' They said, 'Allah and His Messenger know best.' He said, 'It is mentioning about your brother what he dislikes.'

Hadith on Leadership.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Every one of you is a shepherd, and every one of you is responsible for his flock.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A leader who is unjust and oppressive will be brought on the Day of Judgment and will be chained with his deeds.'

Hadith on Leadership.by: Narrated by Sa'd ibn Abi Waqqas
Hadith on Leadership.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Leadership is a trust and on the Day of Judgment, a leader will be brought and asked about the people he was entrusted with.'

Hadith on Love.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'None of you truly believes until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Loving someone for the sake of Allah is a virtue.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of people are those that bring most benefit to others, and the most beloved of deeds to Allah is love for His sake.'

Hadith on Peace.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among you are those who have the most beautiful manners and character.'

The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Shall I not inform you of the best of deeds, the purest of deeds, and the most elevated of ranks?' They said, 'Certainly, O Messenger of Allah!' He said, 'Performing prayer at its proper time, kindness to parents, and striving in the way of Allah.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among you are those with the best manners and character.'

Hadith on Prayer at Night.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best prayer after the obligatory prayers is the night prayer.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever prays at night and then wakes his wife and prays two rak'ahs, will have a reward like that of a person who performs Hajj and Umrah.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) used to pray at night, and he said, 'The night prayer is the most virtuous prayer.'

Hadith on Ablution.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Cleanliness is part of faith.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'When a Muslim performs ablution and washes his hands, face, and feet, his sins are forgiven.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Ablution destroys sins just as fire destroys impurities.'

Hadith on Sadaqah.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best charity is that which is given when one is healthy and greedy for wealth.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The charity given during Ramadan is like giving in charity all year.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Charity does not decrease wealth.'

Hadith on Zakat.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best charity is that given when one is healthy and greedy for wealth.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best charity is that given when one is healthy and greedy for wealth.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of charity is that given in Ramadan.'

Hadith on Seeking Knowledge.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Seeking knowledge is an obligation upon every Muslim.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Seeking knowledge is an act of worship.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever follows a path in pursuit of knowledge, Allah will make easy for him a path to Paradise.'

Hadith on Good Deeds.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among you are those who have the best manners and character.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most beloved of deeds to Allah are those that are most consistent, even if they are few.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The deeds most loved by Allah are those that are continuous, even if they are small.'

Hadith on Evil Deeds.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Avoid the seven destructive sins.' The people asked, 'What are they, O Messenger of Allah?' He said, 'Associating others with Allah, witchcraft, killing a soul whom Allah has forbidden to kill, consuming the orphan's property, consuming usury, fleeing from the battlefield, and slandering chaste women.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The greatest sins are to associate others with Allah and to be undutiful to one's parents.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Every sin is a darkness in the heart, except for sin that is forgiven by repentance.'

Hadith on Hypocrisy.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The signs of a hypocrite are three: whenever he speaks, he tells a lie; whenever he is entrusted, he betrays; and whenever he makes a promise, he breaks it.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The worst of people in the eyes of Allah on the Day of Resurrection will be the two-faced person who has both qualities.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The greatest hypocrisy is to deceive your brother.'

Hadith on Arrogance.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever has an atom's weight of arrogance in his heart will not enter Paradise.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The pride of a person is to wear good clothes and to walk in good streets.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Arrogance is rejecting the truth and looking down on people.'

Hadith on Tawheed.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of what I and the prophets before me have said is: La ilaha illa Allah (There is no deity but Allah).'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever dies knowing that there is no deity but Allah will enter Paradise.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most beloved statement to Allah is: La ilaha illa Allah.'

Hadith on Shirk.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most serious sin is associating others with Allah (shirk).'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Shirk is the greatest of sins.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Avoid the seven destructive sins.' They asked, 'What are they, O Messenger of Allah?' He said, 'Associating others with Allah (shirk)...'

Hadith on Respecting Elders.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who does not honour our elders is not one of us.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who does not show mercy to our young ones and respect to our elders is not one of us.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Respect your elders, and love the young.'

Hadith on Youth.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Take advantage of five before five: your youth before your old age...'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'There is a blessing in youth.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Your youth is a time of blessing, so take advantage of it.'

Hadith on Orphans.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'I and the guardian of the orphan will be in Paradise like these two (and he pointed with his index and middle fingers).'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who looks after an orphan and is kind to him, Allah will be with him in Paradise like these two (and he joined his fingers).'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best house among Muslims is the house where an orphan is treated well, and the worst house is the house where an orphan is treated badly.'

Hadith on Widows.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of you are those who are best to their wives, and I am the best among you to my wives.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among you are those who treat their women kindly.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of you are those who are best to their women.'

Hadith on Modesty in Dressing.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Modesty is part of faith.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Every religion has its characteristic, and the characteristic of Islam is modesty.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Modesty does not bring anything except goodness.'

Hadith on Halal and Haram.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'What is lawful (halal) is clear, and what is unlawful (haram) is clear, and between them are doubtful matters.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The lawful is clear, and the unlawful is clear, and between them are doubtful matters.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah has made lawful trade clear and unlawful trade clear, and between them are doubtful matters.'

Hadith on Gossip.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Gossiping destroys good deeds just as vinegar destroys honey.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A Muslim is the one from whose tongue and hands other Muslims are safe.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Do you know what backbiting is?' They said, 'Allah and His Messenger know best.' He said, 'It is mentioning about your brother what he dislikes.'

Hadith on Anger.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The strong is not the one who overcomes the people by his strength, but the strong is the one who controls himself while angry.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The evil of the angry person is like the evil of Satan.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Anger is from Satan, and Satan was created from fire, and fire is extinguished only by water.'

Hadith on Smiling.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Your smile for your brother is charity.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Smiling in the face of your brother is charity.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Your smile for your brother is charity.'

Hadith on Good Speech.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most beloved of people to Allah is the one who benefits people with his speech.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Speak good or remain silent.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A good word is charity.'

Hadith on Contentment.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Riches do not mean, having a lot of property, but riches is the richness of the soul (contentment).'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The wealth of a person is measured by the contentment of his heart.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best wealth is the wealth of the heart, and the best of good deeds is contentment.'

Hadith on Worldly Life.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The worldly life is but a play and a pastime; the real life is the Hereafter.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The wealth of a person in this world is his health, his wealth, and his good wife.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most beloved of people to Allah is the one who benefits others.'

Hadith on Akhirah.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among you are those who prepare for the Hereafter.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Remember often the destroyer of pleasures—death.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The life of this world is but a temporary enjoyment.'

Hadith on Thankfulness.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'He who does not thank people is not thankful to Allah.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever does not thank people, he does not thank Allah.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Thankfulness is by heart, speech, and action.'

Hadith on Seeking Forgiveness.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Seek Allah's forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance, for Allah loves those who repent.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The one who seeks forgiveness often will have his sins forgiven.'

The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most beloved words to Allah are: 'SubhanAllah' (Glory be to Allah), 'Alhamdulillah' (Praise be to Allah), and 'Astaghfirullah' (I seek Allah's forgiveness).'

Hadith on Trials.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Indeed, the most severely tested people are the prophets, then the righteous, then the martyrs, then the righteous after them.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'No calamity or hardship befalls a Muslim, even if it were a thorn, but Allah expiates some of his sins because of it.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'How wonderful is the affair of the believer, for his affairs are all good.'

Hadith on Signs of Hypocrites.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The signs of a hypocrite are three: whenever he speaks, he lies; whenever he promises, he breaks it; and whenever he is trusted, he betrays.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The worst of people in the sight of Allah on the Day of Resurrection will be the two-faced person.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The signs of a hypocrite are three: whenever he speaks, he lies; whenever he promises, he breaks it; and whenever he is trusted, he betrays.'

Hadith on Visiting Graves.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Visit the graves, for they remind you of the Hereafter.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Visit the graves, for they remind you of death.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Visit the graves, for they remind you of the Hereafter.'

Hadith on Trust in Allah.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Trust in Allah and know that if all the people gathered to benefit you, they would not benefit you except what Allah has written for you; and if they gathered to harm you, they would not harm you except what Allah has written against you.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever relies upon Allah, He will be sufficient for him.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Trust in Allah is from faith.'

Hadith on Destiny.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Nothing will happen to a Muslim by misfortune, illness, or grief, even a thorn that pricks him, except that Allah will expiate some of his sins because of that.'

The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'No one is afflicted with hardship or illness or sorrow or grief or harm or pain— even the prick of a thorn— but Allah expiates some of his sins because of that.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The decree of Allah is completed, and nothing can change it.'

Hadith on Martyrdom.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of people are those who are most beneficial to others, and a martyr is one who is killed in the way of Allah.'

The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The martyr is given six things by Allah: forgiveness at the first drop of his blood, safety from the punishment of the grave, protection from the greatest fear, adornment with the crown of dignity, intercession for seventy members of his family, and security from the Hellfire.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Martyrs are five: one who dies of plague, one who dies of stomach illness, one who drowns, one who is crushed, and one who dies in the way of Allah.'

Hadith on Courage.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The strong is not the one who overcomes the people by his strength, but the one who controls himself while angry.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Courage is not the absence of fear, but the overcoming of it.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'True courage is patience and perseverance in the face of hardship.'

Hadith on Sin.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Every son of Adam commits sins, and the best of those who sin are those who repent.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'All children of Adam make mistakes, and the best of those who sin are those who repent.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Every son of Adam is a sinner, and the best of sinners are those who repent.'

Hadith on Purification.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Purification is half of faith.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Purification is a key to prayer and a means of earning Allah’s pleasure.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Purity is from faith.'

Hadith on Eid.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The two Eids are for celebrating Allah's blessings.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) commanded to perform the Eid prayer, and to make takbir (glorification of Allah).
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The Eid day is a day of celebration, and it is a day of eating, drinking, and remembrance of Allah.'

Hadith on Sacrifice.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The sacrifice (Qurbani) is a Sunnah for your father Ibrahim.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The sacrifice is a Sunnah of your father Ibrahim, and it is a means of approaching Allah.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The animal of sacrifice is a means of worship and an act of charity.'

Hadith on Brotherhood in Islam.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The believers are like a single body; if one part suffers, the whole body suffers.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The believers are like brothers; they unite in love and support each other.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'A Muslim is a brother to a Muslim; he should not oppress him nor disgrace him.'

Hadith on Leadership in Islam.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Each of you is a shepherd, and each of you is responsible for his flock.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The leader of a people is their servant.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Every one of you is a shepherd, and each of you is responsible for his flock.'

Hadith on Reciting Quran.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best among you are those who learn the Qur'an and teach it.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Recite the Qur'an, for it will come as an intercessor for its reciters on the Day of Resurrection.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever recites a letter from the Book of Allah, he will have a good deed recorded for him, and a good deed is multiplied by ten.'

Hadith on Betrayal.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The signs of a hypocrite are three: whenever he speaks, he lies; whenever he makes a promise, he breaks it; and whenever he is entrusted, he betrays.'

The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The worst of people in the sight of Allah on the Day of Resurrection will be the two-faced person who comes to some people with one face and to others with a different face.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most disliked among people to Allah on the Day of Resurrection will be the two-faced person.'

Hadith on Contentment.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Riches are not abundance of property, but true richness is the richness of the soul (contentment).'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The contentment is a treasure that never diminishes.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Contentment is a part of faith.'

Hadith on Piety.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most beloved of people to Allah is the most pious among them.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Fear Allah wherever you are, and follow up a bad deed with a good one to erase it, and behave well toward people.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Piety is here,' and he pointed to his chest three times.

Hadith on Remembrance of Allah.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best of people are those who benefit others, and the best remembrance is the remembrance of Allah.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The heart that is busy with the remembrance of Allah will not be overwhelmed by worries.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The most beloved words to Allah are: SubhanAllah (Glory be to Allah), Alhamdulillah (Praise be to Allah), and La ilaha illallah (There is no deity but Allah).'

Hadith on Friday Prayer.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best day on which the sun rises is Friday; on that day Adam was created.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The Friday prayer is an obligation upon every Muslim, except the slave, woman, and child.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The best day on which the sun rises is Friday; on that day Adam was created, and on that day he was admitted into Paradise.'

Hadith on Allah’s Mercy.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'When Allah completed the creation, His Mercy overshadowed His wrath.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah’s mercy prevails over His anger.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Allah has ninety-nine names, one hundred less one, and whoever enumerates them will enter Paradise; and He is the Most Merciful.'

Hadith on Night of Qadr.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Search for Laylat al-Qadr (Night of Power) in the odd nights of the last ten nights of Ramadan.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever prays during Laylat al-Qadr out of faith and seeking reward will have his previous sins forgiven.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Indeed, Allah has hidden the Night of Power in the last ten nights of Ramadan, seeking it in the odd nights.'

Hadith on Family Ties.text: The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Whoever wishes to have his provision increased and his lifespan extended, let him maintain good relations with his kin.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'The one who cuts off family ties will not enter Paradise.'
The Prophet (Peace Be Upon Him) said, 'Maintain good relations with your kin, even if they cut you off.'
